page.title: 16FISHING IN THE FENS
page.content: There are several kinds of coarse fishing.The most common are ledgering and float fishing. The equipment you want is easy to buy.All you want is a rod and a reel and some floats and some weights and a few hooks and some maggots.You might have a landing net. The pike is the biggest fish which is caught in our waters.Other popular fish are roach,perch,gudgeon and eels. Hundrds of anglers come by bus to fish in our waters at the week ends from angling clubs in Sheffield and Rotherham.Their clubs own the fishing rights along some of the waters. The main fishing season starts in July. The best places to fish are in the Slacker near Black Dyke and under the bridges along the North Level Main Drain.
